resources.string:
Input - Section for inputing the formula for graph.
X logarithmic - Switching between logarithm along the X-axis and normal X-axis.
Y logarithmic - Switching between logarithm along the Y-axis and normal Y-axis.
Tutorial - Section with short explanation of buttons and list of functions and constants.

Fields in the section "Input":
Zoom - the scale of the graph.
Δx - shifting along the X-axis.
Δy - shifting along the Y-axis.
Color - color of the graph.
Thickness - thickness of the graph.
Text field below Color, Thickness - the formula input.
Space above text fields - displaying the formula.

Formula type:
Function. Graph of the function y=f(x). Example: ln(x^2+1)
Inverse function. Graph of the function x=f(y). Example: x=sin(y)

List of functions:

[1] - This is hard to find these functins in google. https://mizugadro.mydns.jp/t/index.php/Tetration
[2] - Function can be applied only for integer values of the argument x. For graphing x is rounding the nearest integer.
[3] - In this programm you can't wirte X factorial as "x!".

P(x) - Prime zeta functon.
sigma(x) - sum of divisors round(x). [2]

C(x) - Composite zeta function.

Beta(x,y)

sqsrt(x)

arcFact(x)
arcFactorial(x)
invFact(x)
invFactorial(x)
Fermi(x) - Fermi estimation in base-10. It was added after reading the first note: https://chtoes.li/paint-the-earth/
Fermi(x, base)
dms(x) - Function from default Windows Calculator.
deg(x) - Function from default Windows Calculator.
Bernoulli(x) - x-th Bernolli number.
bernoulli(x) - x-th Bernolli number.
digits(x) - Count of digits of X in base-10.
digits(x,base) - Count of digits of X in base-base.
concat(x,y) - Concatenation of two numbers. concat(123,456)=123456.
concat(x,y,base) - Concatenation of two numbers ib base-base.
xexp(x)
expinf(x) - x^(x^(x^(x^(...))))
exp^infty(x)
exp^inf(x)
exp^{inf}(x)
exp^{infty}(x)
harmonic(x) - x-th partial sum of Harmonic series.
Harmonic(x)
H(x)
clamp(x,min_val,max_val) - If x<min_val, then min_val, if x>max_val, then max_val, else X.
AuSin(x) - inverse funtion of SuperSine. [1]
sin_{iter}(x,iterations) - nested iterations times sin(x). Note: iterations can be any number. [1]
tet_E(x) - Tetration base E (~2.71828). [1]
tet_{E}(x)
tet_e(x)
tet_{e}(x)
tet(x) - Same as tet_E(x).
pen_E(x) - Pentation base E. [1]
pen_{E}(x)
pen_e(x)
pen_{e}(x)
pen(x) - Same as pen_E(x).
slog_E(x) - Superlogarithm base E. Inverse function of tet_E(x). [1]
slog_{E}(x)
slog_e(x)
slog_{e}(x)
slog(x) - Same as slog_E(x).
sln(x) - Same as slog_E(x).
exp_{iter}(x,iterations) - nested iterations times E^x. Note: iterations can be any number. [1]
pen_2(x) - Pentation base 2. [1]
pen_{2}(x)
SuFact(x)
AuFact(x)
fact_{iter}(x,iterations) - nested iterations times fact(x). Note: iterations can be any number. [1]
apen_E(x) - Inverse function of pen_E(x). [1]
apen_{E}(x)
apen_e(x)
apen_{e}(x)
apen(x) - Same as apen_E(x).
tet_{iter}(x,iterations) - nested iterations times tet_E(x). Note: iterations can be any number. [1]
sinc(x) - sin(x)/x
cosc(x) - cos(x)/x
tanc(x) - tan(x)/x
cotc(x) - cot(x)/x
secc(x) - sec(x)/x
cscc(x) - csc(x)/x
sinhc(x) - sinh(x)/x
coshc(x) - cosh(x)/x
tanhc(x) - tanh(x)/x
cothc(x) - coth(x)/x
sechc(x) - sech(x)/x
cschc(x) - csch(x)/x
sinpc(x) - sinp(x)/x
cospc(x) - cosp(x)/x
tanpc(x) - tanp(x)/x
cotpc(x) - cotp(x)/x
secpc(x) - secp(x)/x
cscpc(x) - cscp(x)/x
erfc(x)
tet_{e^1/e}(x) - Tetration base E^(1/E) (~1.44467). [1]
pen_{e^1/e}(x) - Pentation base E^(1/E) (~1.44467). [1]
SuXexp(x) - Superfunction of xexp(x). [1]
AuXexp(x) - Inverse of SuXexp(x).
xexp_{iter}(x,iterations) - nested iterations times xexp(x). Note: iterations can be any number. [1]
qrsqrt(x) - The algorithm from Quake III for fast calculating 1/sqrt(x), but with less accuracy.
Si(x)
Ci(x)

[1] - This is hard to find these functins in google. https://mizugadro.mydns.jp/t/index.php/Tetration
[2] - Function can be applied only for integer values of the argument x. For graphing x is rounding the nearest integer.
[3] - In this programm you can't wirte X factorial as "x!".

List of cinstants:
pi - The number Pi (~3.14159)
hpi - pi/2
qpi - pi/4
tau - pi*2
e - The number E (~2.71828)
phi - The number Phi (~1.61803)
D - Dottie number - solution of equation cos(x)=x. (~0.73909)
